project_name: Filecoin Onchain Cloud (FOC) - Verifiable Storage, Retrieval, and Payments
filecoin_growth_impact:
**Filecoin Onchain Cloud** extends the Filecoin economy by enabling **service providers** to deliver verifiable storage, retrieval, and payment services entirely on-chain.

By integrating **FWSS**, **PDP**, and **on-chain settlement mechanisms**, FOC unlocks new FIL-denominated transaction flows between clients and providers.

This framework introduces a direct economic layer for on-chain service operation, expanding real FIL utility beyond collateral and deal payments to ongoing data verification, retrieval billing, and automated settlement.
description:
Throughout the RetroPGF Round 3 period, FilOz developed the **Filecoin Onchain Cloud (FOC)** framework that powers verifiable storage, retrieval, and payment services on the Filecoin network.

FOC underpins applications such as **Filecoin Pin**, **Synapse SDK**, **demo.filecoin.services**, **Filecoin Pay**, and **PDP Scan**, enabling service providers and developers to build and operate on-chain data services with verifiable proofs and crypto-native payments.

Together, these components form the foundation for scalable, transparent, and interoperable Filecoin-based cloud services.
additional_impact:
FOC accelerated collaboration across multiple Filecoin ecosystem teams by providing a shared framework for building, testing, and verifying on-chain services.

It introduced standard interfaces for monitoring and validating data operations, simplifying how new service layers interact with the Filecoin protocol.

The project also established operational benchmarks for reliability and performance, informing future service design and infrastructure planning across the broader Filecoin Onchain Cloud roadmap.
end_user:
The Filecoin Onchain Cloud (FOC) serves the next generation of Filecoin Service Providers who deliver verifiable storage, retrieval, and payment services directly on-chain.

It gives SPs a unified operational framework - including FWSS, PDP nodes, and on-chain payment tooling - to run scalable, transparent, and performance-verified infrastructure.

FOC also empowers builders and developers who extend these capabilities through dashboards, SDKs, and data service integrations, creating an open ecosystem of interoperable on-chain services built on Filecoin.
testimonials:
Positive feedback came from **FOC Alpha** participants, early **PDP pilot** operators, and **SPX** cohort members during PDP rollouts and FWSS trials.

Comments in relevant Slack channels and program feedback forms consistently noted clear documentation, fast issue response, and reliable on-chain components.

Judging notes and tracker entries from the FOC Alpha and SPX programs reflected sustained confidence that FOC is a practical foundation for verifiable, on-chain Filecoin services.

[https://app.akindo.io/wave-hacks/1PRjgGzKaTqXaQBBl](https://app.akindo.io/wave-hacks/1PRjgGzKaTqXaQBBl)
how_many_package_downloads:
The **Synapse SDK** (`@filoz/synapse-sdk`) was distributed internally during the RetroPGF Round 3 period for FOC Alpha and SPX testing.  
It was not yet publicly released, so verified download data is not available.
how_many_dependents:
- **Akave - Service Provider Deployment on FOC Infrastructure**  
  Operated live PDP nodes and FWSS instances using FOC APIs, validating verifiable retrieval and on-chain payments in production.

- **Storacha - FOC-Powered Data Storage Marketplace**  
  Integrates FOC components for verifiable storage and retrieval, using FIL-based payments and on-chain verification.

- **Lighthouse - Decentralized Data Hosting via FOC APIs**  
  Built on FOC’s verifiable storage layer to offer persistent, on-chain data services with transparent pricing and auditability.

- **Synapse SDK - Developer Integration Toolkit**  
  Provides builders and ecosystem teams (including Akave and Storacha) with APIs to interface with FOC’s storage, retrieval, and payment functions.

- **FWSS (Filecoin Warm Storage Service) - Operational Layer for Service Providers**  
  Built on the FOC stack to enable service providers to run verifiable warm-storage operations and benchmark on-chain performance.
